result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin M Orlando was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Court's Response to Defendant's letter received 10-3-2016
Letter from the Defendant re: Jail sentence

From defendant regarding crediting time served at another institution.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 10:05 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Justin M Orlando in court, in-custody, with Aattorney Elizabeth F Svehlek. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.

Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 3 years, with conditions:
--serve 60 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-release privileges; to commence 9/1/16 at 6:00 pm 
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--Maintain employment and/or education program or combination thereof, per Agent
--To pay statutory costs, fees and surcharges, including the $250 DNA Surcharge
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--No contact with Richardo Gonzalez
--To pay restitution of $1854.90, payable to Greenwood State Bank
Sentence may be served in Ozaukee County as long as electronic monitoring is not utilized

Days credit for time already served: 14 days
Felony Firearm/Voting Prohibitions Warnings Form Given
Recess: 10:23 am
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 12, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on July 6, 2016 at 11:20 am.

Case called at 1:21 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Justin M Orlando appears in custody, via video, from the Jefferson County Jail, with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient
Atty Svehlek informs the Court that Mr. Orlando is eligible for SPD Services, Atty Hagemann's file was closed after 6 months had lapsed
Atty Svehlek informs the Court that Mr. Orlando failed to appear at last hearing due to transportation issues. At this time he now has transportation and a stable residence, provides updated address.
Bond arguments by Counsel

Court requires a $5000 CASH bond, with no special conditions:
Atty Svehlek 
Recess: 1:27 pm 

NEXT: (1)  Schedule DA PTC 7/6/16 at 11:20 am - Send notices (2) Counsel to contact Court's JA for scheduling - Send notices

ADDRESS INFO for Justin M Orlando
Current: 1581 W. Portview Dr., Port Washington, WI 53074 United States  (Effective: 06-30-2016)
Prior: 7944 Mehring Road, Waterford, WI 53185 United States
Defendant in custody // Duplicate Original Warrant document returned from JCSD

Case called at 2:17 pm [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for STC)
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Attorney Whitney Hagemann in court. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Justin M Orlando not in court.  
Atty Hagemann: No explanation for Mr. Orlando's non-appearance. Have not had recent contact with Mr. Orlando
DA Happ requests warrant, informs the Court that Mr. Orlando also has warrant out of Rock County
Court revokes and forfeits bond and orders issuance of bench warrant - Body Only
Recess: 2:21 pm

ADDRESS INFO for Justin M Orlando
Current: 7944 Mehring Road, Waterford, WI 53185 United States  (Effective: 09-03-2015)
Prior: 411 S Center Ave, c/o Jefferson County Jail, Jefferson, WI 53549 United States
Conditions of this Amended Bond include:  Mr. Orlando is required to live at the 7944 Mehring Road, Waterford WI address.

Reserve Judge Nettesheim presiding for Branch IV:  
[MK] case called at 3:13pm. 
Defendant Justin M Orlando in court, in custody, with Attorney Whitney Hagemann.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Mr. Orlando waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charge and maximum penalties are recited
--plea of "not guilty" entered

After hearing arguments on bond, the Court modifies the bond from a cash bond to a $1,000 Signature Bond with the special condition:  Mr. Orlando is required to live at the 7944 Mehring Road, Waterford WI address.
recess 3:19pm.  

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on 9/16/15 at 11:00am    (2) Status Conference on 10/9/15 at 2:00pm

Case called at 1:24-pm. [mo]
[Commissioner Onheiber presiding for Branch II Intake]
Defendant Justin M Orlando appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Whitney Hagemann and Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa (PD will appoint counsel). Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Speedy Preliminary Hearing requested by the Defense 

Bond Arguments given by Counsel
The Court requires a $250 CASH bond, with NO conditions 

Attorney Hagemann indicates that Mr. Orlando does qualify for PD representation 
recess 1:32pm 


NEXT: Preliminary Hearing on 9/3/15 at 3:00pm (time limits apply)
